alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:57PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Randolph and central Chambers Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 157 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Roanoke to 7 miles east of West Point. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Valley, Lanett, Roanoke, Stroud, La Fayette, Lakeview, Five Points, Post Oak Forks, Denson, River View, Amity Park, Standing Rock, Welch, Buffalo, Fredonia, Veasey Creek Park, Huguley, Fairfax, Penton and Southern Harbor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
